title: Teriyaki Chicken Rice Bowls
ingredients: 1½ pounds boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut crosswise into ½-inch thick slices
instructions: Combine the teriyaki sauce and sugar in a measuring cup, stirring until the sugar dissolves.  Remove 3 tablespoons of the mixture and pour it over the chicken placed in a large plastic food storage bag.  Close the bag securely and turn it over several times, massaging, to coat the chicken pieces well.  Leave the bag in the refrigerator to marinate for at least 15 minutes.
Meanwhile, add enough water to the remaining teriyaki sauce mixture to measure ⅔ cup.  Blend in the cornstarch.

Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.  Add the chicken and sauté it for 5 minutes.  Add the teriyaki sauce mixture and cook, stirring, for about one minute or until the sauce boils and thickens slightly.
Spoon the chicken over steaming rice in individual serving bowls.
Remarks:  Steamed vegetables may also be served as a side dish.
Source:  Recipe Extra, San Antonio Express News, Wednesday, August 15, 2001.
